0.title: Imran not in his senses anymore, must be treated as psychopath: Nawaz Sharif's daughter
0.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz has tweeted, "One person who is not in his senses anymore cannot be allowed to wreak havoc & bring the entire country down." She added, "He shouldn't be treated as PM or ex-PM, he must be treated as a psychopath who just to save his own skin is holding the entire country hostage."

1.title: I have a great bonding with SRK, he's a great listener: Sonu Sood
1.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has said that he has a great bonding with actor Shah Rukh Khan, adding that the latter is a great listener. Sonu added that the two spent a lot of time together while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year'. "He really takes care of you as an elder brother, as a producer," Sonu said.

2.title: Russia expels 45 Polish diplomats in a tit-for-tat move
2.article_body: Russia has expelled 45 Polish embassy and consulate staff and declared them "persona non grata", the Russian Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Poland expelled the same number of Russian diplomats in March. Poland had said the Russian diplomats were suspected of working for Russian intelligence. Russia has given the diplomats time till April 13 to leave the country.

3.title: I don't know about the big day myself: Neetu on Ranbir-Alia's wedding
3.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor, when asked about her actor-son Ranbir Kapoor's wedding to actress Alia Bhatt, told ETimes, "I would like to celebrate it and say it out loud. But kids today are different." She added, "I don't know about the big day myself, as both are very private people." She also said, "Alia and Ranbir are made for each other."

4.title: We've become debt-free, repaid ₹2,925 crore loans: Ruchi Soya
4.article_body: Edible oil major Ruchi Soya has said that it has repaid ₹2,925 crore loans to banks and has become a debt-free company. The money was paid to a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India. Baba Ramdev's Patanjali Ayurved-led Ruchi Soya has recently raised ₹4,300 crore through its follow-on public offer.

5.title: Suryakumar Yadav is the Shah Rukh Khan of MI: Harbhajan Singh
5.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said MI batter Suryakumar Yadav is the Shah Rukh Khan of the franchise, referring to his 'Main Hoon Na' celebration in IPL 2020. "When he first came he was a bit fat but Suryakumar has lost a lot of weight in the past few years, and worked a lot [on] his game," added Harbhajan.

6.title: Will take strict action: Yogi govt after UP CMO's Twitter account hacked
6.article_body: After the Twitter account of UP CM's Office was briefly hacked, CM Yogi Adityanath-led state government said strict action will be taken against those responsible. The breach came to light when unidentified hackers published a post based on a tutorial called "How to turn your BAYC/MAYC animated on Twitter" on the CMO's account. They also changed the account's profile picture.

7.title: Russia has lost over 19,000 troops since invasion began: Ukraine
7.article_body: Ukrainian officials have claimed that Russia has lost over 19,000 troops since its invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Officials said Russia has also lost 1,891 armoured personnel vehicles, 700 tanks and 135 helicopters. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Thursday admitted that Russia had suffered "significant losses of troops" in what Russia calls a "special military operation" in Ukraine.

8.title: European Union to resume diplomatic presence in Kyiv
8.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Friday announced that it will resume its diplomatic presence in Kyiv. Notably, the EU's decision comes after a retreat by Russian forces from areas around the Ukrainian capital recently. The EU had moved its diplomatic mission to Poland after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 following months of tensions.

9.title: Govt websites hacked as Ukraine Prez addressed Parliament: Finland
9.article_body: Finland's government website and those of several ministries were hit by a cyberattack at the same time that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was giving a video address to the Parliament on Friday, the government said. However, the situation has been normalised, Finland's Foreign Ministry said. Finland on Friday also reported a violation of Finnish airspace by a Russian state aircraft.

10.title: Will bring the best content for people: Ayushmann on upcoming projects
10.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, while talking about his upcoming projects, said he is confident that he will be bringing the best content for people to watch in 2022. "I have always looked to handpick projects that are out of the ordinary," Ayushmann said. The actor will be seen in three upcoming films, titled, 'Anek', 'Doctor G' and 'Action Hero'.

11.title: Germany may reintroduce COVID-19 measures in fall: Health Minister
11.article_body: Health Minister Karl Lauterbach on Friday said Germany may reintroduce certain COVID-19 measures such as mask-wearing in public in the fall when cases are expected to rise. German lawmakers on Thursday voted against imposing a COVID-19 vaccination mandate on people aged 60 and older. The mandate was supported by both German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Lauterbach.

12.title: Tom Holland buys Porsche Taycan Turbo S worth ₹2.13 cr, shares pic
12.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has purchased a Porsche Taycan Turbo S which is worth ₹2.13 crore. He took to Instagram to share a picture of the car, writing, "'Electric' Peter Kay. Thanks Porsche for helping me go electric." As per a report, Tom also owns an Audi RS7, Audi RS7 Sportback, Audi Q7, Audi R8 and Rolls Royce Cullinan Black Badge.

13.title: Four booked for gang-raping differently-abled woman in Gujarat
13.article_body: Police booked four men for allegedly gang-raping a woman in her late twenties, who is speech and hearing impaired, multiple times in Gujarat's Mehsana. The woman's son had informed his father about the incident, police said. When her husband confronted the accused, they threatened to kill the couple and their child and forced them to leave Mehsana, police added.

14.title: Sec 144 imposed after stones pelted at Shobha Yatra in Karnataka
14.article_body: After stones were allegedly pelted at the Rama Shobha Yatra procession on Friday night, prohibitory orders under CrPC Section 144 were imposed in Karnataka's Mulbagal.  According to the police, five people have been taken into custody till now. "As there was a disruption in the electricity supply, some miscreants may have taken advantage," Kolar SP D Devaraj said.

15.title: Central agencies looking into hoax bomb threat to B'luru schools: Min
15.article_body: After several schools in Bengaluru received hoax bomb threats via email, Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra today said that central agencies are looking into the matter. Jnanendra added that police are trying to find out who was behind the hoax threat. Meanwhile, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has claimed that this was a "conspiracy" to disturb the peace in the state.

16.title: UN seeks $80 million to prevent oil spill disaster off Yemen coast
16.article_body: The UN said it is seeking $80 million from donor nations to fund an emergency operation to remove a million barrels of crude oil from a tanker anchored off the coast of Yemen. An oil spill from the FSO Safer tanker "would unleash a massive ecological and humanitarian catastrophe", UN Resident and Humanitarian Coordinator for Yemen, David Gressly said.

17.title: BJP's personal agenda is to prioritise Hindi over other languages: HD Kumaraswamy
17.article_body: Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy has criticised Home Minister Amit Shah over his statement that Hindi should be an alternative to English. Kumaraswamy also accused the BJP-led Centre of imposing their "personal agendas" on citizens. "Central government...(is) actually trying to forcibly run their personal agendas. But they won't succeed. People will teach them a lesson," he said.

18.title: Used to sneak out silently when Happy New Year cast went to party: Sonu
18.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has stated that people find it very difficult to take him to parties. The actor said that they were travelling while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year', Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone used to say, 'Let's go party'. "I used to sneak out silently. It's very difficult to party with me," Sonu added.

19.title: Odisha to establish hockey clubs in schools across all districts
19.article_body: Ahead of the FIH Hockey World Cup 2023 in Bhubaneswar, the Odisha government is all set to launch its 'Mo School Hockey Club' programme. The programme aims to establish a hockey club in at least one school of each district. There will be around 24-30 students in each wing of the club selected from Class 6 onwards, officials said.

20.title: Sebastian Vettel fined ₹4.12 lakh for riding scooter on Australian F1 track
20.article_body: Aston Martin driver Sebastian Vettel has been fined €5,000 (₹4.12 lakh) for riding a scooter on the Albert Park circuit following the conclusion of Free Practice 1 for the Australian Grand Prix on Friday. Vettel had borrowed the scooter from the marshals. The four-time champion was deemed to have broken Article 26.7 of the Sporting Regulations of Formula One.

21.title: Ram Charan to play double role in Shankar's 'RC15': Report
21.article_body: Actor Ram Charan will reportedly play a double role in Shankar Shanmugham's upcoming project tentatively titled 'RC15'. According to reports, the actor will be seen portraying the role of an officer and a student in the bilingual political drama. Written by Karthik Subbaraj, the film's music will be composed by S Thaman. It will also feature Kiara Advani.

22.title: Jamia ties up with digital online learning firm to impart skills to students
22.article_body: The Jamia Millia Islamia's placement cell has tied up with an online digital learning platform, IBM Skills Build-CSRBOX Foundation, to equip its students with essential technical skills. “The collaboration will facilitate the delivery of free digital learning to JMI students through the acquisition of essential skills like technical, professional and job readiness skills,” JMI said in a statement.

23.title: Chip undersupply to last until 2024: Volkswagen CFO
23.article_body: Volkswagen Chief Financial Officer Arno Antlitz has said that the supply of semiconductors is unlikely to completely meet the demands again until 2024. "The structural undersupply will likely only resolve itself in 2024," Antlitz said. He added that some issues might begin to ease towards 2022-end, with production returning to 2019 levels next year.

24.title: Nothing to worry: K'taka CM after Pai seeks PM's help over B'luru roads
24.article_body: Reacting to Information Technology industry veteran TV Mohandas Pai's remarks on Bengaluru's roads, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is no such reason to worry. Bommai also assured that there will be large-scale road repair works in the city in the coming days. Notably, Pai had tweeted, "[Bengaluru's] roads are bad and traffic sucks...[PM Narendra Modi, please intervene and help]."

25.title: NASA to resume crucial Artemis 1 Moon mission's 'wet dress rehearsal'
25.article_body: NASA will be resuming its 'wet dress rehearsal' for Artemis 1 Moon mission today. It began the rehearsal, a practice run of the most important prelaunch activities, last Friday. However, the attempt was suspended after a valve issue surfaced during tanking. The rehearsal includes a full countdown, loading the rocket's tanks with supercold propellant and draining the rocket tanks.

26.title: 'Mud volcano' erupts at a temple in Taiwan; video goes viral
26.article_body: A video of a 'mud volcano' that erupted at a temple in the Pingtung County of southern Taiwan has gone viral on social media platforms. The video showed the eruption spewed large amounts of mud and water above ground that flowed into surrounding roads and fields. The bursts reached as high as a one-storey building.

27.title: WMA writes to PM Modi, seeks solution against violence on doctors
27.article_body: The World Medical Association has written to PM Narendra Modi asking him to address violence against doctors in India. "Countering non-negligent treatment errors with prosecution...is not only unjust but will also have grave consequences," the letter read. "We observe an increasing rate of violence against [doctors]...This is a serious situation," said Dr Otmar Kloiber, WMA Secretary-General.

28.title: Plenty of unused COVID vaccine doses, won't buy fresh stock: Pune hospitals
28.article_body: Private hospitals in Pune have reportedly claimed that they have plenty of unused COVID-19 vaccine doses and are reluctant to order fresh stock. "We have 5,000-6,000 doses...and hardly 10 people are coming each day," Ruby Hall Clinic's CEO Bomi Bhote said. "We will be ordering after we've exhausted our pending stock of 3,000 doses," an official at Jehangir Hospital said.

29.title: I was asked to send pictures without clothes: Ankit Siwach on casting couch
29.article_body: TV actor Ankit Siwach, who began his modelling career in Delhi 12 years ago, recently spoke about facing the casting couch. The actor admitted that coming from Meerut to Delhi was a "culture shock" for him, adding, "I was asked to send pictures without clothes." He also said, "I was asked to come to parties that weren't related to work."

30.title: Country didn't only love me, but it also hit me with shoes: Rahul
30.article_body: Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Saturday commented that India not only gave him love but also hit him with shoes. "I thought why is this happening? And got the answer that the country wants to teach me...The country is telling me that you should learn, understand," he said. He made the comments at the launch of a book.

31.title: Many girls would relate to my character in 'Lost': Pia Bajpiee
31.article_body: Actress Pia Bajpiee while talking about her next film 'Lost' said many girls would relate to her character. "It touched a chord with me...She is powerful, ambitious and vulnerable at the same time," Pia added. She further said that working with director Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury was like being in an institute as she learned a lot from him.

32.title: J&K ex-minister Babu Singh, absconding in Hawala case, arrested
32.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir minister Jatinder Singh alias 'Babu Singh', the main accused in a Hawala racket case that was busted by the police last month, was arrested from Kathua on Saturday. According to Jammu SSP Chandan Kohli, Jatinder Singh is being brought to Jammu for interrogation in connection to the Hawala money which was meant for subversive activities.

33.title: They weren't leaked from school or anywhere: Abhishek on pics of daughter shared online
33.article_body: On being asked how safe he feels when his daughter Aaradhya's pictures circulate on the internet with some even leaked from school, Abhishek Bachchan said, "No, they were not leaked from the school or anywhere." He added, "You'll shoot her whenever she steps out of the house. It is what it is. There is no point analysing it."

34.title: Rajkummar Rao wraps up shooting for Netflix's 'Guns & Gulaabs'
34.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has completed shooting for his upcoming Netflix project titled 'Guns & Gulaabs'. "This journey wouldn't have been the same without you guys," Rajkummar wrote on Instagram while posting a picture with directors Raj Nidimoru and Krishna DK. Produced by D2R Films, 'Guns & Gulaabs' will be Rajkummar Rao's first series with Netflix.

35.title: Teammate of Kohli for a long time, first time he's so relaxed: Karthik
35.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he has been a teammate of Virat Kohli for a long time, but this is the first time Kohli is so relaxed. "There is so much time on his hands, I'm able to have long conversations," added Karthik. "I am genuinely enjoying it," stated Karthik. RCB have won two out of three IPL 2022 matches.

36.title: Delhi likely to get respite from rising temp in next 2 days: IMD
36.article_body: IMD official RK Jenamani on Saturday said that Delhi is likely to get some respite from rising temperatures in the coming two days. According to IMD, the national capital on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, the highest so far this year. The maximum temperature at most places in Delhi on Friday settled at least seven degrees above normal.

37.title: Supply of mangoes to Pune to increase after April 20: Report
37.article_body: The supply of mangoes to Pune city is expected to improve after April 20, a Hindustan Times report said citing a trader. Due to a decline in supply this year, the prices of Ratnagiri and Devgad Alphonso mangoes range from ₹1,200 to ₹2,500 a dozen. The prices of other varieties of mango range from ₹600 to ₹1,000 a dozen.

38.title: 3 feared drowned as boat carrying 11 capsizes in river Ganga in Bihar
38.article_body: Three persons are feared drowned after a boat capsized in river Ganga near Brahmchari ghat in Bihar's Patna on Saturday. According to local residents, the small country boat carrying 11 people capsized due to high waves and strong currents. Prima facie, it appears that the boat was unable to sustain the weight of its occupants, an SDRF official said.

39.title: 13 arrested for raising anti-national slogans in Srinagar mosque
39.article_body: A total of 13 people have been arrested by Srinagar Police in the case related to anti-national and provocative sloganeering in and around Jamia Masjid, police said on Saturday. A video that surfaced on social media purportedly showed men raising Azadi slogans in the mosque. This was the first congregational prayer held in the mosque in the month of Ramzan.

40.title: Baffled by SRH's decisions, Williamson should bat at no. 3: Harbhajan
40.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said he is baffled by SRH's decision making with captain Kane Williamson opening for the franchise in IPL 2022, rather than batting at number three position. "Williamson's best numbers have come in IPL as well as for New Zealand when he has batted at number three," added Harbhajan. SRH are yet to record a win in IPL 2022.

41.title: Illegal weapons supplier held with 4 pistols in Gurugram
41.article_body: Police arrested an illegal weapon supplier and seized four pistols from him near Gurugram's Sohna. Police said they tried to stop a car coming from Sohna but the driver did not pay heed. "We somehow stopped the car and found two men inside. One of them fled as soon as the car was stopped, the other was nabbed," police said.

42.title: Avoid travelling to Shanghai due to arbitrary COVID curbs: US to citizens
42.article_body: The US has asked citizens to reconsider travel to China and avoid visiting COVID-19 hotspots, including Shanghai, due to "arbitrary enforcement" of virus restrictions amid the country's worst outbreak. The COVID-19 curbs include "the risk of parents and children being separated", the US warned. The US also authorised the "voluntary departure" of non-essential staff from its consulate in Shanghai.

43.title: Dissolve Petroleum Ministry with immediate effect: Akhilesh Yadav
43.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Centre over hike in fuel price and said that Central government is "robbing the people". "If no government regulations...can control this reckless hike in fuel prices, and if everything is up to the market then what is the use of Petroleum Ministry? These ministries should be shut down with immediate effect," he tweeted.

44.title: I know Rashid Khan will get me out of the worst situations: Hardik
44.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya said he knows spinner Rashid Khan will help the team escape in the worst situations, adding that Rashid is his trump card. "I want batters to attack Rashid," stated Hardik. "He is an aggressive spinner which I don't see a lot," said Hardik. GT have recorded three wins in as many IPL 2022 matches.

45.title: India's 1st indigenous Polycentric Prosthetic Knee made: IIT M
45.article_body: IIT Madras researchers launched India's "first" indigenously made Polycentric Prosthetic Knee, 'Kadam'. It'll help above-knee amputees to walk with a comfortable gait. It's designed with high strength stainless steel and aluminium alloy along with hard chrome plated EN8 pins and high fatigue life polymer bushings. The Society for Biomedical Technology and Mobility India supported the development.

46.title: We sent message to Mayawati for alliance, offered CM post: Rahul
46.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that amid the Uttar Pradesh elections, his party had sent a message to BSP chief Mayawati for an alliance and offered her the CM post, but she didn't respond. He also claimed that she didn't fight for "Dalit voices" because of CBI, ED and Pegasus. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.

47.title: Hope to have same equation with Alia I had with my mother-in-law: Neetu
47.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor has stated that her relationship with her mother-in-law Krishna Raj Kapoor was outstanding. She added that Krishna loved her more than her son late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor. "I hope to have the same equation with Alia because she is outstanding and amazing," Neetu said. Alia and Ranbir are reported to get married on April 14.

48.title: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh to star in Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather'
48.article_body: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh has signed on to act in Chiranjeevi-starrer 'Godfather'. Chiranjeevi made the announcement on Twitter, adding that Jagannadh will be seen in a special role in the film. Helmed by Mohan Raja, 'Godfather' is the Telugu remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. The film also stars Nayanthara and Satyadev Kancharana in key roles.

49.title: Russian air strikes to increase in Ukraine's south, east: UK
49.article_body: Russian air activity is expected to increase in Ukraine's south and east, the UK's Defence Ministry said. The ministry added that "Russia is continuing to hit Ukrainian non-combatants, such as those killed in yesterday's rocket strike on Kramatorsk railway station in eastern Ukraine". At least 52 people were reportedly killed and several others were injured in Friday's railway station attack.

50.title: Insomnia could increase the risk of type 2 diabetes: Study
50.article_body: According to a study, people with insomnia are at an increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes. Insomnia symptoms cause higher Hemoglobin A1C levels, indicating it plays a causal role in the condition. "Eating healthy balanced diet, being active, along with getting enough sleep, are all essential for...those at risk of, or living with, type 2 diabetes," a researcher said.

51.title: Mizoram has started issuing identity cards to Myanmar refugees: Official
51.article_body: Myanmar government has started issuing identity cards to refugees from Myanmar, a Home Department official said. "The cards will facilitate speedy...easier identification of refugees...prevent them from enrolling in the state's voters' list," the official added. A total of 29,532 Myanmarese refugees have sought shelter in Mizoram since the military takeover in February 2021, as per official data.

52.title: Covishield and Covaxin vaccine prices for private hospitals cut to ₹225 per dose
52.article_body: Serum Institute of India revised the price of Covishield vaccine for private hospitals from ₹600 to ₹225 per dose. Bharat Biotech also revised the price of Covaxin vaccine from ₹1,200 to ₹225 per dose for private hospitals. Earlier today, the Centre said, "Private COVID-19 vaccination centres can charge only up to a maximum of ₹150 as service charge for vaccination."

53.title: Can't be selfish to discuss Liverpool contract right now: Mo Salah
53.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has said that he can't be "selfish" to discuss his contract while the club is focused on winning trophies. "I can't be selfish and talk about my (contract)," Salah said. "We (Liverpool) are in the most important period...so I have to just talk about (Liverpool)," he added. Notably, Salah's contract expires in June 2023.

54.title: IIIT-Lucknow student gets ₹1.2 cr package with Amazon job, institute's highest-ever
54.article_body: A final year B.Tech student at Indian Institute of Information and Technology, Lucknow, has bagged the institute's highest-ever annual salary package of ₹1.2 crore. Abhijeet Dwivedi has been hired as a software development engineer for Amazon in Dublin, Ireland, TOI reported. "I saw several videos to prepare myself for the interview. Soft skills matter a lot," Dwivedi said.

55.title: Which players have hit a six off the last ball of the 20th over to win an IPL match?
55.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia became the 10th cricketer to slam a six off last delivery to win an IPL match. Rohit Sharma, Ambati Rayudu, Saurabh Tiwary, Dwayne Bravo, MS Dhoni, Mitchell Santner, Nicholas Pooran, Ravindra Jadeja and Srikar Bharat are the other nine batters to do so. Rohit did it thrice, against KKR (2009), PWI (2011) and Deccan Chargers (2012).

56.title: Go to India if you like it so much: Ex-Pak PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter to Imran Khan
56.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Sharif has criticised Imran Khan for praising India. She tweeted, "Someone should tell a person who has gone mad after seeing this power gone that he has been expelled by his own party and no one else." She added, "If you like India so much then shift there and leave the life of Pakistan."

57.title: Veteran Telugu actor M Balayya passes away aged 94
57.article_body: Veteran Telugu actor M Balayya passed away at the age of 94 on Saturday morning. Balayya had made his debut as an actor with 'Ettuku Pai Ettu' in the year 1958 and acted in nearly 300 films. He also received the Gold Nandi Award from Andhra Pradesh government for his play 'Nalupu Telupu' which was later made into 'Chelleli Kapuram'.

58.title: Rahman shares poster on Tamil after Shah said Hindi should replace English
58.article_body: Composer AR Rahman has shared a poster titled 'Tamizhanangu' highlighting the significance of Tamil. The poster also has poet Bharathidasan's line 'Inba Thamizh Engal Urimai Sempayirukku Vaer' (Delightful Tamil is the root of the staple crop of our rights). This comes after Home Minister Amit Shah stated that Hindi should be an alternative to English for people from different states.

59.title: 69 police trainees hospitalised after having dinner at Maha training centre
59.article_body: As many as 69 police trainees from the Police Training Centre in Maharashtra's Dhule were hospitalised after they complained of stomach ache and vomiting. According to Dhule SP Pravinkumar Patil, it seems the trainees fell ill after having dinner. The SP added that the condition of the trainees is stable now and 29 of them have been kept under observation.

60.title: Sindhu, Srikanth lose in the semis at 2022 Korea Open
60.article_body: Third seed PV Sindhu lost in women's singles semi-final at 2022 Korea Open on Saturday. She was defeated by second seed An Seyoung of South Korea 21-14, 21-17 in 48 minutes. In men's singles semi-final, Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth, seeded fifth, lost to third seeded Jonatan Christie 19-21, 16-21 in 49 minutes. With this, India's campaign ended in the tournament.

61.title: 40-year-old neighbour kidnaps, rapes 6-year-old girl in Thane
61.article_body: A 40-year-old man allegedly abducted a six-year-old girl from his neighbour and raped her inside his home in Thane, a police official said. The accused, who is identified as Anwar Shaikh, fled from the spot after being confronted by neighbours, Inspector (Crime) Sunil Shinde said. Police have launched an investigation into the matter and are trying to nab the accused.

62.title: Dead shark in UK found to have meningitis in a 'world's first' case
62.article_body: A rare Greenland dead shark found washed up on a beach in the UK's Cornwall had meningitis, post mortem concluded, which scientists are calling the "world's first" such case. The female shark, thought to be around 100 years old, was found by walkers last month. The shark's brain was "discoloured and congested", while the fluid around the brain was cloudy.

63.title: Was born in centre of power but I don't have interest in it: Rahul
63.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was born in the "centre of power", but he "honestly" doesn't have an interest in it. He claimed that there're politicians who think about attaining power throughout the day, then sleep and repeat the cycle, while he tries to understand the country instead. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.

64.title: AAP was about to remove Anup Kesari on allegation of dirty acts against women: Sisodia
64.article_body: A day after AAP chief in Himachal Pradesh Anup Kesari joined BJP, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that the party was about to remove him on the allegation of dirty acts against women. "The place of such people is in BJP only," Sisodia added. "The top leadership of the BJP is scared of AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal," Sisodia tweeted.

65.title: Police arrest 3 for stealing LPG gas from cylinders in Pune
65.article_body: Pune Police have recently arrested three people involved in pilfering LPG gas from cylinders and illegally selling it. A tempo, 31 full cylinders and six empty cylinders were seized from their possession. "The accused were found transferring...gas from cylinders and filling them into empty ones. We raided the premises and caught the accused red-handed," a senior police official said.

66.title: Austrian Chancellor Nehammer to visit Ukraine, meet Prez Zelenskyy
66.article_body: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer's office on Friday said he has set off on a one-day visit to Ukraine where he will meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "It is important that within the framework of our neutrality we stand by Ukraine on a humanitarian level as well as politically," Nehammer said. Although neutral, Austria has provided Ukraine with humanitarian aid.

67.title: EU chief offers Ukraine fast-track membership to European Union
67.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Friday offered Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy paperwork that will allow Ukraine to become a member of the European Union. "It will not be, as usual, a matter of years, but rather a matter of weeks," she said. Her visit to Ukraine is the first by top EU officials since Russia's invasion began.

68.title: Test blast at Noida's Supertech towers on Sunday, locals told to stay indoors
68.article_body: Ahead of the test explosion at Supertech twin towers in Noida Sector 93A on Sunday, an advisory was issued asking residents of nearby societies to remain indoors from 2:15-2.45 pm. Traffic will remain suspended on the stretch for 30 minutes. "It'll be a...low-intensity blast to check the amount of explosives required for the main explosion," Emerald Society RWA president said.

69.title: Bottom-placed SRH to bowl first against winless CSK, playing XIs announced
69.article_body: SRH won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in their IPL 2022 clash. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Maheesh Theekshana replacing Dwaine Pretorius. SRH have included Shashank Singh and Marco Jansen in their playing XI. Both the teams are winless in the tournament, with SRH being last on the points table.

70.title: German Prez calls for probe into war crimes against Putin, Lavrov
70.article_body: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on Friday called for a war crimes tribunal against Russian President Vladimir Putin and Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. "Anyone who has responsibility for these crimes will have to explain themselves," Steinmeier said. "That includes soldiers. That includes military commanders. And of course also those that have the political responsibility," he added.

71.title: Employee steals Delhi employer’s bike over unpaid dues, demands ₹20,000
71.article_body: A 25-year-old man in Delhi's Nihal Vihar stole his employer's motorcycle and demanded ₹20,000 in exchange for returning it, police said. During interrogation, the accused, identified as Anoop Singh, disclosed that his employer refused to pay his pending dues, so he stole his bike to teach him a lesson and get his money back. He has been arrested, police said.

72.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant expands his Cabinet by inducting 3 more ministers
72.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Saturday expanded his Cabinet by inducting three more MLAs as ministers. BJP MLAs Nilkanth Halarnkar and Subhash Phaldesai and Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP) MLA Sudin Madhav Dhavalikar took oath in the presence of CM Sawant. Goa Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai administered the oath of office to the three new ministers.

73.title: 1st all private crew to ISS carries US hospital mascot soft toy
73.article_body: The first all private crew to the space station, launched by SpaceX, carried a plush toy of 'Caramel', the mascot for the Montreal Children's Hospital Foundation, as its zero-g indicator. The crew selected Caramel as their indicator in part because of the mission's connection to the hospital. Caramel was earlier briefly mistaken for Disney's rabbit Thumper from Bambi.

74.title: Woman dragged on road while trying to resist snatching bid in Delhi
74.article_body: A 23-year-old woman was allegedly dragged on the road for a few metres while trying to stop three bike-borne men from snatching her handbag in Delhi's Mundka. One of the snatchers was caught by the public after the woman screamed for help, while the two others fled. Meanwhile, police have registered a case and are looking for the absconding suspects.

75.title: 110 arrested for protesting outside Sharad Pawar's Mumbai house
75.article_body: A total of 110 persons have been arrested in connection with the protest outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's Mumbai house on Friday. The employees of MSRTC protested, claiming he didn't do anything for their demand of merging the corporation with the state government. On Friday evening, 103 were arrested on charges of rioting, unlawful assembly, assault and criminal conspiracy.

76.title: Japan bans Russian coal imports, expels eight diplomats
76.article_body: Japan PM Fumio Kishida on Friday announced the expulsion of eight Russian diplomats and a ban on Russian coal imports in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. "Russia has repeatedly violated international humanitarian law by killing civilians and attacking nuclear power plants. These are unforgivable war crimes," Kishida added. Russia accounted for 11% of Japan's total coal imports in 2021.

77.title: Delhi HC dismisses plea moved by fugitive against extradition proceedings
77.article_body: Delhi HC dismissed a plea moved by a fugitive accused seeking quashing of extradition proceedings. The petitioner is an accused in a rape case lodged in London in 2017. "This court is of the considered view...petition is premature," HC ruled. Extradition proceedings were initiated without due compliance with the Extradition Treaty between India and the UK, the petitioner's counsel said.

78.title: UK FM Sunak's wife Akshata to pay UK taxes on global earnings amid criticism
78.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's India-born wife Akshata Murthy said she'll pay UK taxes on her global earnings following a row over her non-domicile status. Noting that her tax arrangements are "entirely legal", Murthy said, "I do this because I want to...I do not wish my tax status to be a distraction for my husband or to affect my family."

79.title: My husband Rishi was a full-time job, thaka dete the: Neetu
79.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor, speaking about the demise of her husband actor Rishi Kapoor, has said that she got back to work because she didn't know where her life would have gone. "My husband was a full-time job...Thaka dete the (He would tire me out)," she added. Neetu further said that even her children told her to get herself busy.

80.title: Pune man loses ₹17 lakh after being lured by 'Playboy' male escort job
80.article_body: Cyber fraudsters allegedly cheated a 27-year-old unemployed man of over ₹17 lakh on the pretext of giving him a job in a male escort service named 'Playboy', police said. The accused had promised the victim that he'll be paid ₹3,000 per hour and asked for 'license fees'. The victim reportedly paid ₹17 lakh using his deceased father's savings and FD.

81.title: Private centres can take up to ₹150 as service charge for COVID-19 booster dose: Govt
81.article_body: Union Health Secretary on Saturday said that the precaution dose will be of same vaccine which was used for administration of previous two doses and no fresh registrations would be required on CoWIN. Private vaccination centres can charge up to a maximum of ₹150 as service charge for vaccination over and above the cost of vaccine, the government added.

82.title: 3 teens die, 3 hospitalised after consuming poison in Bihar's Aurangabad
82.article_body: Three teenage girls died and three others were hospitalised after six friends consumed poison together in Bihar's Aurangabad on Friday. The girls had reportedly gone to the pond outside their village in the evening and consumed a poisonous substance in the field. They were rushed to a hospital when villagers spotted them. Police are investigating the reason behind the incident.

83.title: Stand up for refugees: Priyanka to world leaders in video amid Ukraine crisis
83.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to social media to make an appeal to the world leaders amid the Ukraine-Russia war. "World leaders, we need you to stand up for refugees around the world to ensure that they get the support they need now," the actress said. "We can't just stand by and watch. It's gone on too long," she added.

84.title: Same-sex couple in Maharashtra sign MoU for legal protection after harassment by family
84.article_body: A same-sex couple, comprising a 28-year-old woman and a 19-year-old woman, seeking validity for their relationship registered a notarised MoU in a Pune court to ensure protection from their families who are against their relationship. The family of the 19-year-old began to harass them and since February, they faced "serious threat to their lives", the couple's lawyer Vikas Shinde said.

85.title: Exercise can lower risk of getting bowel cancer: Research
85.article_body: According to research, exercising multiple times a week over an extended period of time can reduce the risk of developing bowel cancer. Cancer-fighting substances such as IL-6 are released into the bloodstream when a person exercises regularly, a researcher said. These substances interact with abnormal cells, repairing their DNA and reducing the growth of cancer, he added.

86.title: I accept and respect the decision: Will Smith on 10-year Oscars ban
86.article_body: Will Smith said, "I accept and respect the Academy's decision," after the actor was banned from attending the Oscars or other related events and programs for 10 years for slapping presenter Chris Rock. In a statement, the Academy had called Smith's behaviour "unacceptable and harmful". Smith had slapped Chris after he joked about his wife's Alopecia condition at the Oscars.

87.title: Lmaooo: Musk on Bezos-owned paper criticising his new role at Twitter
87.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "Lmaooo" in response to The Washington Post op-ed titled, 'Elon Musk's vision of 'free speech' will be bad for Twitter'. It said, "Musk's appointment to Twitter's board shows that we need regulation of social-media platforms to prevent rich people from controlling our channels of communication." World's second-richest man Jeff Bezos owns The Washington Post.

88.title: India's forex reserves fall by $11.173 billion in steepest weekly fall ever
88.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves slid by $11.173 billion to $606.475 billion in the week ended April 1, marking the steepest weekly fall ever, data from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. This is the fourth consecutive weekly fall in the country's forex reserves. The latest weekly decline in reserves was due to a plunge in foreign currency assets (FCAs).

89.title: 12-year-old girl raped in public toilet near Pune railway station
89.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped in a public toilet near Pune railway station. The accused has not been identified yet, police said. The girl's mother, who is a resident of an area near the toilet, said the incident took place when her daughter went to relieve herself at the toilet. Police have launched a search to arrest the accused.

90.title: Tesla may have to mine, refine lithium as its price is insane: Musk
90.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to lithium's rising price over the years, saying, "Price of lithium has gone to insane levels! Tesla might actually have to get into the mining and refining directly at scale, unless costs improve." "There is no shortage of the element itself, as lithium is almost everywhere...but pace of extraction/refinement is slow," Musk added

91.title: Govt reserves 25% defence procurement budget for domestic private industry
91.article_body: Ministry of Defence reserved ₹21,149 crore or 25% of the domestic capital acquisition budget for the domestic private industry to encourage the private sector to take part in defence production. This comes two months after India earmarked 68% of the capital procurement budget for the entire domestic industry. India allocated ₹5.25 lakh crore for military spending in this year's budget.

92.title: Wanted to hit sixes, nothing else in mind: Tewatia on 3-ball 13* vs PBKS
92.article_body: Reacting to his 3-ball 13* which helped GT chase down 19 runs in the final over against PBKS, all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he just wanted to hit sixes with nothing else in his mind. "The last [shot] was off the middle of the bat...I knew it was [a] six," added Tewatia. GT are unbeaten in IPL 2022 so far.

93.title: I tried to pull De Villiers and Kohli away at times, jokes Maxwell
93.article_body: Recalling IPL 2021, RCB batter Glenn Maxwell joked that he tried to pull AB de Villiers and Virat Kohli away at times, terming them as "two peas in a pod". "When De Villiers announced his retirement, it was a...shock," said Maxwell. "It was awesome to have a few drinks with De Villiers and discuss life," added Maxwell.

94.title: Museum on history of cartoon art set up at Savitribai Phule Pune University
94.article_body: A first-of-its-kind museum on cartoon art has been set up at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SSPU). Visitors can reportedly view the works of famous Indian cartoonists as well as a variety of cartoon art from across India, spread over 200 years. The biggest section is devoted to cartoons and illustrations done during the establishment of the 'British Raj', reports stated.

95.title: He reminds me of Kohli at his prime: Shastri on Gill's 59-ball 96
95.article_body: Talking about GT opener Shubman Gill's 96 off 59 balls at a strike rate of 162.71 in the win against PBKS, Ravi Shastri said Gill reminds him of Virat Kohli at his prime. "Gill batted beautifully again, really really beautifully," added Shastri. "People would love to pay money to watch him bat when in full flow," stated Shastri.

96.title: Gurugram man stabs mother for not helping him reconcile with his wife
96.article_body: The Gurugram police arrested a 44-year-old man for allegedly stabbing his 66-year-old mother to death. The accused Manish revealed that his wife had left home due to some personal dispute and he was trying hard to reconcile with her but his mother was not very keen on it and was pressuring him not to bring her back, the police said.

97.title: Kejriwal ignored and insulted us: Anup Kesari after joining BJP
97.article_body: Former Himachal Pradesh AAP chief Anup Kesari criticised Arvind Kejriwal and accused him of "being ignorant" against AAP Himachal unit leaders during a roadshow in Mandi constituency. "Arvind Kejriwal overlooked the state party workers when he came for a rally. In the hill state, AAP workers considered this ignorance as an insult and quit the party for self-respect," Kesari said.

98.title: Navi Mumbai student arrested for stocking, circulating child porn via Insta
98.article_body: A 23-year-old student from Navi Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly circulating and stocking child pornography via messages on Instagram, police said. The accused had allegedly created an account on Instagram under a fake identity for this purpose. Police have seized the accused's mobile phone, which contains several such videos, along with financial transactions related to the content.

99.title: Kidnapped Pune land dealer rescued from Nepal border in UP; 2 held
99.article_body: Two people were arrested and four others are absconding after a land dealer, who was kidnapped from Pune, was rescued from near India-Nepal border in Uttar Pradesh. The accused had kidnapped the dealer on March 24 after calling him under the pretext of paying for the land they'd purchased, police said. The accused had demanded ₹10 lakh ransom, police added.

100.title: AT&T's WarnerMedia, Discovery merge, become Warner Bros Discovery
100.article_body: AT&T WarnerMedia unit and Discovery have completed their merger and the combined entity will be called Warner Bros Discovery. The new firm's portfolio includes Discovery Channel, Warner Bros Entertainment, CNN, HBO, Cartoon Network, streaming services Discovery+ and HBO Max and franchises like 'Batman' and 'Harry Potter'. It'll start trading on Monday under the ticker symbol 'WBD'.

101.title: Delivery of blood samples by drones begins in Gurugram
101.article_body: A private diagnostics company began a pilot project in Gurugram to collect blood samples from hospitals using drones and deliver them to labs. The aim of using drones is to cut down on turnaround time and provide faster test reports. A four-day trial will take place in and around Gurugram to test the efficacy of the system, the officials said.

102.title: Saudi Arabia to allow 1 million Muslim pilgrims for Haj 2022
102.article_body: Saudi Arabia has said it'll allow one million people, from both inside and outside the kingdom, to attend the Haj pilgrimage this year, state media reported. Only people aged under 65 who have been vaccinated against COVID-19 will be allowed to take part, the Ministry of Haj said. Last year, the kingdom limited the annual Haj to 60,000 domestic participants.

103.title: Malaika Arora pens post on her accident, says 'Feels like a scene from a film'
103.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora took to Instagram to pen a post on her car accident which occurred last week. "Last few days and events that unfolded have been quite unbelievable. Thinking about it in retrospect feels like a scene from a film and not something that actually happened," she wrote. "I'm a fighter...I’ll be back before you know it!" she added.

104.title: How much did Congress earn and spend in FY21 as compared to FY20?
104.article_body: The income of Indian National Congress declined by over 58% in financial year 2020-21, down from ₹682.2 crore in the previous fiscal to ₹285.7 crore, according to its audit report submitted to Election Commission. The party's expenditure dipped from ₹998.15 crore in the previous fiscal year to ₹209 crore in FY 2021. Congress' income in FY19 stood at ₹918 crore.

105.title: Odisha govt engineer held over disproportionate assets worth over ₹5 cr
105.article_body: An assistant engineer, working in the Odisha Water Resources Department, was arrested for possessing disproportionate assets worth over ₹5 crore in Bhubaneswar, an officer said. The vigilance officials raided the engineer's house and seized over ₹2 crore in cash, the highest cash seizure in the history of Odisha Vigilance and 20 gold biscuits weighing around 580 grams, among other valuables.

106.title: B'luru police reunites boy who got lost with his parents in 6 hrs
106.article_body: Bengaluru's Yashavanthapura traffic police station tweeted that it helped reunite a boy who got lost in a crowd after locating his parents within six hours. The traffic police said that one of their personnel had spotted the boy who was in a "state of fear", gave him food and reassured him. The traffic police also shared pictures of the incident.

107.title: Yes, Alia-Ranbir's wedding is happening and I've been invited: Alia's half-brother
107.article_body: Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt in an interview with Bombay Times confirmed that the actress is getting married to actor Ranbir Kapoor. "Yes, the wedding is happening and I have been invited. I will be there for the ceremonies," he said. On welcoming Ranbir to the family, he said, "I haven't met Ranbir in the capacity of Alia's boyfriend."

108.title: 3 given 10 years imprisonment for attempting to rape woman in Guj
108.article_body: Three persons were sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment by a Rajkot court in Gujarat for attempting to gang-rape a woman. Two of the three convicts admitted they tried to rape the woman who had gone to fetch water from a village tap in May 2020. The third one, on the other hand, was recording the video, they confessed.

109.title: Boycott Muslim drivers for travel to Hindu temples: K'taka right-wing group
109.article_body: A right-wing outfit in Karnataka on Friday launched a campaign for a boycott on using Muslim cab drivers or tour operators for travelling, especially to Hindu temples and shrines. "We don't eat [non-vegetarian food] and taking someone who doesn't believe in our gods...would be a disrespect," a member of the outfit claimed. The outfit visited homes across the state.

110.title: Pakistan PM Imran Khan skips parliament on trust vote day
110.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan was absent in the country's parliament, which commenced proceedings on Saturday to take up the trust vote against him. Reports said Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf may be trying to filibuster the vote by prolonging the debate to prevent the decision entirely, a tactic that originated in US in 1880s. Khan has been Pakistan's PM since 2018.

111.title: After US & UK, EU imposes sanctions on Putin's 2 daughters
111.article_body: The European Union announced new sanctions on 217 people, including Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova, over Ukraine. "We're not targeting ordinary Russians. We're targeting...Kremlin, the political, economic elites supporting Putin's war in Ukraine," EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said. Earlier, the US & UK sanctioned Putin's daughters.

112.title: Staff's health has dipped in 2 yrs: Zerodha CEO on weight loss challenge
112.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath shared "more context" over the firm's weight loss challenge for employees, saying the employees' average health levels have "dipped in the past 2 years". "As a company, the onus is to...nudge everyone on the team to think about their health," Kamath said. He has faced backlash for promising half month's pay to staff who lose weight.

113.title: Jharkhand HC issues notice to CM Hemant Soren for owning mining lease
113.article_body: Jharkhand High Court on Friday issued notice to CM Hemant Soren over a petition filed against him for owning a mining lease of a 0.88-acre area in capital Ranchi's Angara block and called it a "serious matter". Soren got the lease allegedly by misusing his position as the Minister for the Department of Mines, the petition alleged.

114.title: Players forced to wait on ground as IPL debutant Sudharsan takes toilet break, video goes viral
114.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing PBKS and GT players being forced to wait on ground as GT debutant Sai Sudharsan took a toilet break after eight overs. An over later, strategic time out was taken, which caused further delay in match proceedings. Sai Sudharsan scored 35 runs off 30 deliveries as GT won by six wickets.

115.title: US denies 'warning' India on Russian oil imports
115.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki denied that US Deputy NSA Daleep Singh delivered a warning to India over Russian oil imports during his visit. "I wouldn't characterise it as a warning, nor did we at the time," Psaki said. "It's the decision of each individual country, including India, to determine whether they're going to import Russian oil," she added.

116.title: COVID-19 XE variant detected in 67-year-old Mumbai man visiting Gujarat
116.article_body: The XE variant of COVID-19 has been detected in a 67-year-old man, who was visiting Gujarat's Vadodara from Mumbai. The patient had tested positive for coronavirus during his stay at a hotel on March 12. We are getting more details and trying to trace his close contacts, Manoj Aggarwal, the additional chief secretary of the state's health department, said.

117.title: Russia shuts Amnesty Int'l, other human rights organisation offices
117.article_body: Russia said it's revoking the registration of 15 foreign non-profit organisations, including Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch (HRW). The decision to shut the offices follows "the discovery of violations of the current legislation of the Russian Federation", Russia's Justice Ministry added. "There's little doubt the move was in response to our reporting on the war in Ukraine," HRW said.

118.title: Ready for talks with Maoists if they express faith in Constitution: Baghel
118.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday said government is ready for talks with Maoists if they express faith in the Indian Constitution. According to state government data, Maoist-related violence has dipped from 479 incidents in 2017 to 226 in 2021. While acknowledging the decrease, Baghel added, "We want peace and normalcy to return to Bastar and...make...efforts in this direction."

119.title: Sisodia to visit Gujarat schools to 'inspect' BJP's work in education sector
119.article_body: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia said that he will be visiting Gujarat on Monday for an "inspection" of the state's government schools to know about BJP's work in the sector for the past 27 years. This comes after Gujarat Minister Jitu Vaghani said that those who are unhappy with Gujarat's education system should move to other states or countries.

120.title: Cult leader, who raped women for 30 years in London home and scared them with robot, dies
120.article_body: Aravindan Balakrishnan, a Maoist cult leader who imprisoned women for 30 years in his south London house and raped them, died in jail aged 81. Balakrishnan was convicted of a number of offences, including child cruelty, false imprisonment and assault. He used to terrify his prisoners with a made-up robot he called 'Jackie' which he claimed could read their minds.

121.title: New COVID-19 wave is sweeping across Europe: UN chief
121.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Friday said, "We're seeing 1.5 million new (COVID-19) cases each day. Large outbreaks are spreading in Asia. A new wave is sweeping across Europe." Guterres added that the next variant isn't a question of "if" but of "when". "And with new variants emerging every four months on average, time is of the essence," Guterres stated.

122.title: Hyderabad police arrest 4 people, seize 315 gm of hash oil
122.article_body: Hyderabad City Police arrested four people and seized 315 grams of hash oil from them. The accused were reportedly involved in procuring hash oil and selling them to needy customers. The Bowenpally Police, based on a tip-off, arrested the accused near Ganga Putra Sangam on Thursday. They also recovered two bikes and ₹15,000 cash from the accused.

123.title: Guj temple invites over 100 Muslim residents to offer namaz, break Ramzan fast
123.article_body: Over 100 Muslim residents of Dalvana village in Gujarat were invited to offer namaz and break their fast during Ramzan on the premises of Varanda Vir Maharaj Mandir on Friday evening. A priest at the 1,200-year-old temple said this was the first time the temple premises were opened for Muslim residents. "We've always believed in co-existence and brotherhood," he added.

124.title: Lightning strikes due to unseasonal rains kill 2 in MP; 12 injured
124.article_body: Two people were killed and 12 others were injured in separate incidents of lightning strikes due to unseasonal rains and thunderstorms in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni on Friday, an official said. A district administration official told PTI that a sudden change in the weather had occurred between 5pm and 6pm. A 58-year-old man and a 16-year-old boy are the two deceased.

125.title: Around 87,000 family cards issued to sex workers in TN: State minsiter
125.article_body: The State Minister for Food and Civil Supplies R Sakkarapani has said that 86,986 Smart Family (Ration) Cards have been issued to sex workers across Tamil Nadu. He also said that the Tamil Nadu Government has provided 2,429 family cards to transgenders till March 21, 2022. Notably, the state government has deleted 1,98,264 bogus ration cards, he said.

126.title: Baffled to not see any yorker: Jaffer on Odean's 19-run final over
126.article_body: Discussing PBKS all-rounder Odean Smith conceding 19 runs in the final over against GT, Wasim Jaffer tweeted that he was baffled to not see Odean bowl a single yorker. An overthrow by Odean brought Rahul Tewatia on strike, who hit two sixes off the final two deliveries, with 12 runs needed to win. GT defeated PBKS by six wickets.

127.title: India beat Korea 3-0 in junior women's hockey World Cup quarter-final
127.article_body: India defeated Korea 3-0 in the quarter-final match of the junior women's hockey World Cup in Potchefstroom on Friday. Lalrindiki, Mumtaz Khan and Sangita Kumari scored the goals for India. Mumtaz was adjudged as the 'Player of the Match'. India will now face the Netherlands in the semi-final on Sunday.

128.title: Bitcoin makes up 60% of my liquid portfolio: Mexican billionaire
128.article_body: Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego at a conference revealed that Bitcoin and Bitcoin equities make up 60% of his liquid portfolio, adding the remaining 40% is in hard-asset stocks like oil and gas and gold miners. He said he doesn't have any bonds. "Bond investment is a terrible investment. I wouldn't touch a bond with a 10-foot pole," Ricardo added.

129.title: Parties against RSS, PM Modi should come together: Rahul Gandhi
129.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that discussions were on to unite Opposition parties against PM Narendra Modi, RSS and what should be the framework of it. "The BJP thinks that by spreading hatred or by beating up people, economy can be improved," Gandhi added. "We have to bring people together. Our tradition of brotherhood must be restored," Gandhi further said.

130.title: 7 injured as fire breaks out in parking area in Gurugram's Rajiv Nagar
130.article_body: At least seven people suffered minor burn injuries after a fire broke out in the parking area of lane number 13 in Gurugram's Rajiv Nagar on Saturday, fire department officers said. Three motorcycles and two scooters were gutted, and the fire spread quickly towards a house, officers added. "It's suspected...short circuit in a motor caused the fire," an official said.

131.title: Cong denied permission to hold protest in Guj, police cites 'anti-govt slogans'
131.article_body: Congress was denied permission by police to hold a protest against "rising prices" and "unemployment" at Bahumali Bhavan Chowk in Gujarat's Rajkot. DCP Praveen Kumar cited the spread of COVID-19 and the possibility of raising anti-government slogans as the reasons for denying permission. Meanwhile, Congress alleged that the police is "acting as a tool in the hands of the BJP".

132.title: Himachal road transport bus skids off road, hits tree near Shimla; 4 injured
132.article_body: Four persons sustained injuries after a Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) bus skidded off the road and crashed into a tree near Chaili village on the outskirts of Shimla. As per reports, the accident took place due to speeding. The injured persons, including the driver and conductor of the bus, were rushed to Indira Gandhi Medical College (IGMC) for treatment.

133.title: Hardik Pandya has really not lived upto expectations: Russel Arnold
133.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said GT captain Hardik Pandya has really not lived upto expectations, adding that there is a lot more to come from Hardik. "If he plays more balls, scores more runs...quietly gets his strike rate up and sets himself up for the death overs...I think he will be more destructive," added Russel.

134.title: Road accident victim's family gets over ₹ 35 lakh compensation in Punjab
134.article_body: The family of a 35-year-old man, who was killed after a truck hit his car near Punjab's Zirakpur in 2018, has been awarded a compensation of ₹35,35,400 lakh by Chandigarh's Motor Accident Claims Tribunal. The truck driver, owner and insurer had denied the petition. But the tribunal allowed the claim and awarded compensation to the victim's wife, child and parents.

135.title: Still 2 years younger for it: Amit Mishra to fan saying 'Sir, please come to CSK'
135.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra, who went unsold in IPL mega auction, took to Twitter to respond to a fan who had requested him to join CSK. "Sorry mate, still two years younger for it," the 39-year-old cricketer replied. Notably, in last few IPL seasons, CSK's average age was one of the highest, with fans terming the team as 'Dad's Army'.

136.title: If Rahul Tewatia was on Titanic, even that wouldn't have sunk: Kaif
136.article_body: Reacting to GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia's 13* off three balls against PBKS which included consecutive sixes with 12 runs needed off two balls, Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "If Tewatia was on Titanic, even that wouldn't have sunk". "Need Tewatia's statue in PBKS dugout," read Virender Sehwag's tweet. Irfan Pathan jokingly enquired on Twitter if Tewatia has some issue against PBKS.

137.title: They have a lot of problems: Harbhajan on CSK's worst start to IPL season
137.article_body: Talking about CSK recording their worst start in an IPL season, Harbhajan Singh said there are a lot of problems with the team which is why they have lost their first three IPL 2022 matches. "They do not have someone like Deepak Chahar, who can give them early wickets with the new ball," added Harbhajan.

138.title: Karnataka minister Eshwarappa, BJP corporator booked for hate speech
138.article_body: Karnataka Police has lodged an FIR against state minister KS Eshwarappa and BJP corporator Channabasappa on charges of making provocative statements following the murder of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha in Shivamogga. The complainant, who is a local resident, claimed that because of Eshwarappa's communal incitement and statements of provocation, Shivamogga witnessed violence after Harsha's murder.

139.title: We will never let Hindi be our national language: Siddaramaiah
139.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday said that as a Kannadiga, he took "strong offence" to Union Minister Amit Shah urging people to talk in Hindi. He added, "Hindi isn't our national language and we will never let it...be." Earlier, Shah said that people in different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, instead of English.

140.title: Court dismisses Khalid Saifi's bail plea in 2020 Delhi riots case
140.article_body: A Delhi court rejected UAPA-accused and United Against Hate founder Khalid Saifi's bail plea in connection with a 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case. Saifi had connectivity with other accused and their cumulative role must be seen to comprehend the entire conspiracy, the court said. There was no evidence he gave a provocative speech to instigate anyone, Saifi's lawyer said.

141.title: Against the Constitution: TMC MP on Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark
141.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy criticised Amit Shah's remark that "people from different states should speak Hindi instead of English" and said that imposing Hindi in non-Hindi speaking states is "against" the Constitution. "If BJP forcibly wants to impose Hindi on non-Hindi speaking states then it will be protested and resisted. Even Nehru said that Hindi won't be imposed," Roy added.

142.title: Binance ready to follow sanctions on Russian officials: Ukraine
142.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has confirmed the "readiness to follow the sanctions policy on the Russian officials involved in military aggression", Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said. "During the call with Changpeng Zhao agreed on verifying their Ukrainian users," Fedorov added. Earlier in February, Fedorov called on major crypto exchanges to block Russian users' addresses.

143.title: Conflict in Ukraine's Donbas region could be knife fight: US
143.article_body: Eastern Ukraine's Donbas region, held by rebels, is becoming the "main scene of battle" after Russia failed to take the capital Kyiv, US Defense Department warned. Conflict in Donbas could be a "knife fight" as both sides are familiar with the terrain, population centres and access routes, a US defense official said. The fight could be "very bloody", official added.

144.title: Accused bite, assault Mumbai Police constables while resisting arrest
144.article_body: Three constables of Mumbai Police were injured after an accused and his accomplice, who were being escorted to the police station on Thursday, allegedly assaulted them. One of the accused, bit a constable's hand, whereas the other tore the uniform of another constable while trying to flee. However, the police overpowered them and brought them to police station.

145.title: Jennifer Lopez, Ben Affleck get engaged again, 18 years after their failed engagement
145.article_body: Singer-actor Jennifer Lopez and actor Ben Affleck are engaged once again. The 52-year-old shared a video of herself crying and looking at her engagement ring on Friday night on her official website. This comes 18 years after their first engagement had failed. Jennifer and Affleck had reunited last year, with Jennifer making the relationship public on her 52nd birthday.

146.title: Parliament can stop NGOs from receiving foreign funds: SC
146.article_body: Upholding the amendments in the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA), 2010, Supreme Court said that Parliament can stop non-governmental organisations (NGOs) from receiving foreign donations. "Receiving foreign donations cannot be an absolute or even a vested right," it added. "The foreign aid can create the presence of a foreign contributor...influence the country's policies," SC stated.

147.title: Pune woman kills husband, hangs body to pass off as suicide; held
147.article_body: A 40-year-old woman has been arrested in Pune for allegedly strangling her 44-year-old husband to death and then hanging his body to pass it off as suicide. The police questioned the woman and family after an autopsy revealed that the deceased was strangled. The woman confessed to the crime and claimed she'd done so due to her husband's constant harassment.

148.title: Conspiracy: Karnataka CM on hoax bomb threat at Bengaluru schools
148.article_body: After multiple schools in Bengaluru received hoax bomb threats via emails, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday claimed that this was a "conspiracy" to disturb the peace in the state. He added that police should "consider these cases seriously". A police officer said that the hoax bomb threats coincide with exams and they'd received similar hoax threats before during exams.

149.title: 33 students of law university in Gujarat test COVID-19 positive in last 2 days
149.article_body: As many as 25 students of Gujarat National Law University in Gujarat's Gandhinagar tested positive for COVID-19 on Friday, taking the tally of infected students to 33 since Thursday. Following this, Gandhinagar Municipal Corporation (GMC) has declared the campus a containment zone. "We have suspended offline classes. From Monday, classes will be held online," a university official said.

150.title: Russian missile that killed 52 at Ukraine station had 'for the children' written on it
150.article_body: A missile that struck a train station in Ukraine's Kramatorsk and killed 52 people, including five children, had the words "for the children" painted on it in Russian. Ukraine's Defence Ministry described it as "taking bestial brutality and moral depravity to the next level". The phrase translated as a message that the missile was sent in vengeance for children.

151.title: LSG look like they will struggle every time on paper: Graeme Smith
151.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said he thinks LSG are going to struggle every time he looks at their IPL 2022 squad on paper. "Their bowling attack is not outstanding on paper," added Smith. "But they are actually playing well as a team," stated Smith. LSG have won three out of their four IPL 2022 matches played so far.

152.title: 2 force-feed cycle tube solution to children in Guj to push them into begging
152.article_body: Two persons have been booked for allegedly force-feeding 'cycle tube solution' to around seven children, aged between seven and 12, in Gujarat's Ahmedabad in order to force them into street begging. The accused used to force a 16-year-old boy from Uttarakhand to sell drugs to the children and beat him up if he failed to provide them with sufficient money.

153.title: Fire at factory in Delhi's Anand Parbat Industrial Area, 6 firefighters injured
153.article_body: Six firefighters were injured while trying to douse the fire that broke out at a factory in Delhi's Anand Parbat Industrial Area on Saturday.  All the injured firefighters were rushed to B L Kapoor Hospital. The fire was reportedly caused due to blast in LPG cylinders at 4:45 am. Ten fire tenders were deployed to bring the fire under control.

154.title: Pic of Mayank Agarwal consoling Odean Smith after defeat vs GT goes viral
154.article_body: A picture of PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal consoling Odean Smith after defeat against GT has gone viral on social media. Smith conceded 19 runs off the last overs, including 12 runs off the last two deliveries, as GT won by six wickets. "The last over could have been anyone's game," Agarwal said after the match.

155.title: RPF constable walks 4 kms on Mumbai's railway tracks to search commuter's phone
155.article_body: A Railway Protection Force (RPF) constable walked more than four kilometres on live railway tracks in WR's Mumbai division to look for newly purchased mobile phone of a traveller. The mobile phone of Deen Mohammed Qureshi, who was travelling on Dehradun Express, fell between Saphale and Vaitarna stations. Qureshi reached Saphale station at around 1 am to search his phone.

156.title: British, French divers rescued in Malaysia after over 2 days at sea
156.article_body: A French woman and a British man who disappeared while diving off the coast of Malaysia on Wednesday noon were found safe on Saturday, police said. Rescuers are still searching for Briton Adrian Chesters' 14-year-old son, who also went missing. The boat operator who took them to the dive site has been detained after testing positive for drugs, police added.

157.title: Which players have hit 2 sixes to win an IPL match with 12 runs needed off last 2 balls?
157.article_body: With 12 runs needed off last two deliveries, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia smashed two sixes off Odean Smith to help his team defeat PBKS (formerly KXIP) in their IPL encounter. MS Dhoni is the only other player to have smashed two consecutive sixes on last two balls to win an IPL match. He had done so against PBKS in 2016.

158.title: Jharkhand govt extends time-limit for Ram Navami processions till 10 pm
158.article_body: The Jharkhand government has extended the time-limit for religious processions till 10 pm, in view of demands from various Ram Navami puja committees and political parties. Earlier on March 30, the state government had permitted the processions till 6 pm. State Health minister Banna Gupta had met CM Hemant Soren on Thursday and requested him to extend the time limit.

159.title: Pant's strike rate an issue, strong finish never came against LSG: Smith
159.article_body: Discussing DC captain Rishabh Pant's 39* off 36 balls at a strike rate of 108.33 in their loss against LSG, ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said Pant's strike rate is an issue. "The strong finish never came. DC needed to get...a total of 170-180," added Smith. LSG defeated DC by six wickets after being handed a target of 150 runs.

160.title: Amazon calls for new election after workers vote for 1st US union
160.article_body: Amazon has called for an election re-run after its NYC warehouse workers voted to create the company's first US union. It has accused the Amazon Labor Union (ALU) of intimidating workers and distributing marijuana to gain votes in its favour. "We want our employees to have their voices heard, and in this case, that didn't happen," an Amazon spokesperson said.

161.title: Hyd Police Commissioner rewards officers for Mahesh Bank hack probe
161.article_body: Hyderabad City Police Commissioner CV Anand rewarded 69 Cyber Crime team members for investigating the Mahesh Bank hack case, involving the illegal transfer of ₹12.48 crore. Further, 28 officers of various police stations were also honoured for their performance on Friday. The officers were rewarded on the basis of technical expertise, responsiveness, swift investigation and detection of cases.

162.title: 19-yr-old kills self in Chandigarh, parents allege harassment by friends
162.article_body: A 19-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide at his friend's paying guest (PG) room in Chandigarh. The deceased's parents have alleged that he was being harassed by other boys in the PG. His parents claimed the boys had recorded a video of him apologising to a girl for sexually harassing her in sleep and circulated it among his family members.

163.title: Hindus reject it: Tharoor on mahant's rape threat to Muslim women
163.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday reacted to the video of a Hindu mahant threatening to publicly rape Muslim women, saying, "The vast majority of Hindus reject and disown such elements." He added that as a Hindu, he can tell his Muslim friends that "thugs" like this don't represent Hindus just like an Islamic State extremist doesn't represent them.

164.title: EC transfers 2 police officers four days ahead of Asansol by-polls
164.article_body: Election Commission on Friday transferred two police officers of Asansol Durgapur Commissionerate, ahead of Asansol by-polls to be held on April 12. Abhijit Chatterjee, inspector in-charge of Asansol South Police Station, and Sanjib De of Jamuria Police Station were transferred out. The Asansol Lok Sabha seat fell vacant after former MP Babul Supriyo quit BJP last year to join TMC.

165.title: UP jails to play 'Gayatri Mantra' for inmates' peace of mind: Min
165.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Jail Dharmveer Prajapati on Friday announced that the 'Gayatri Mantra' and 'Mahamrityunjaya Mantra' will be played at the prisons across the state to provide inmates with "peace of mind". He also called for the organisation of sermons by "sants and mahants" at jails to "create a better atmosphere for prisoners".

166.title: AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari, 2 others join BJP
166.article_body: Anup Kesari, president of Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Himachal Pradesh unit, along with general secretary organisation Satish Thakur and Unna chief Iqbal Singh joined BJP. "Arvind Kejriwal overlooked the state AAP workers when he came for a rally...they considered this ignorance...quit for self-respect," Kesari said. "Only Kejriwal...Bhagwant Mann participated in the roadshow," Singh said.

167.title: Punjab govt failed to maintain law and order, regulate sand prices: Sidhu
167.article_body: Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government and said that the state government is "failing" to maintain law and order situation and regulate the sand prices in Punjab. "Only announcements are being made...no notification regarding any announcement has been issued so far. The price of electricity is also likely to increase from the next month," he said.

168.title: 7 arrested for dancing to music on roof of moving cars in Maha's Nagpur
168.article_body: As many as seven persons were arrested for allegedly dancing to music on the roof of moving cars in Sadar area of Maharashtra's Nagpur, a police officer said. The matter came to light when a video of the alleged incident went viral on social media, he added. A total of five cars have been seized so far.

169.title: Sonam-Anand's Delhi residence robbed; cash and jewellery worth ₹1.41 crore stolen: Report
169.article_body: Actor Sonam Ahuja and Anand Ahuja's Delhi residence was robbed and cash and jewellery worth ₹1.41 crore was stolen, as per a report. In a police complaint lodged on February 23, Anand's grandmother Sarla claimed that she got to know of the theft on February 11 when she checked her cupboards for jewellery and cash, the report added.

170.title: Moderna recalls 7,64,900 COVID-19 vaccine doses over contamination in Europe
170.article_body: Moderna has said it is recalling 7,64,900 doses of its COVID-19 vaccine made by its contract manufacturer Rovi after a vial was found contaminated. No safety issues have been identified in the lots that were distributed in Norway, Poland, Portugal, Spain and Sweden in January, Moderna added. Moderna was recalling the whole lot out of "an abundance of caution".

171.title: India declares 26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed's son a designated terrorist
171.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has issued a notification declaring Hafiz Talha Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Mohammad Saeed, as a designated terrorist. "Hafiz Talha Saeed has been actively involved in recruitment, fund collection, planning and executing attacks by...LeT in India and Indian interests in Afghanistan," MHA said. His father had masterminded the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks.

172.title: They're being misled: Pawar as MSRTC employees protest outside his house
172.article_body: After over 100 workers of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) protested outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai on Friday, he said that they are being misled. "ST employees and we have a very old relationship, in the last 40-50 years I've not missed any session with them," Pawar added. Notably, police arrested MSRTC employees' leader Gunaratna Sadavarte.

173.title: Punjab to set up 333 urban wellness centres: Health Minister
173.article_body: Health Minister Dr Vijay Singla on Friday announced Punjab government will set up 333 urban wellness centres in urban and semi-urban areas across the state. "The government will be utilising public buildings...rest of infrastructure, including machines and laboratories will be provided by the department," Singla said. "A special fund will be allocated in the budget for this project," he added.
