"If the passenger is unable to pay the fine, then they will be arrested by the railway police," said Manoj Jhawar, Pune railway division spokesperson.

350.title: Pic of horse travelling in a crowded train in West Bengal goes viral, probe ordered
350.article_body: A photo of a horse standing inside a crowded local train in West Bengal is being widely circulated on social media. While the Railways has ordered a probe into the incident, a fact-check of the photo has also been ordered. The horse was reportedly returning after taking part in a race in Baruipur with its owner.

351.title: 3 Adani Group firms get ₹15,400 crore investment from Abu Dhabi's IHC
351.article_body: Adani Enterprises announced on Friday that Abu Dhabi-based conglomerate International Holding Company PJSC (IHC) will invest $2 billion as primary capital in three Adani Group companies. IHC will invest ₹3,850 crore in Adani Green Energy, ₹3,850 crore in Adani Transmission, and ₹7,700 crore in Adani Enterprises. The boards of the companies have approved the transaction, Adani Enterprises said.

352.title: Sonu Sood granted Dubai Golden Visa, actor says 'I'm grateful'
352.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has been granted the Dubai Golden Visa. "I'm incredibly honoured and grateful to...Dubai government for Golden Visa. Dubai has been one of my favourite destinations to visit. It's a dynamic place to thrive. I'm thankful to...authorities for the privilege," he said on receiving the Golden Visa. Boney Kapoor and his family also hold the Dubai Golden Visa.

353.title: Mahindra's deal to sell SsangYong to S Korea's Edison terminated
353.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra's deal to sell its subsidiary SsangYong Motor to South Korean electric carmaker Edison Motors has been terminated. Edison's inability to deposit the bid amount led to the termination of the deal, Mahindra said in an exchange filing. Mahindra owned about 75% of SsangYong as of September-end 2021, which it bought in 2010.

354.title: Dealer who supplied gun to Northeast Delhi riot accused held
354.article_body: A firearms dealer was arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly supplying a pistol to Shahrukh Khan, who is accused of rioting during the Northeast Delhi riots in 2020. "Babu Wasim had been absconding for over two years... Wasim has admitted to having supplied the said pistol... to Shahrukh Khan prior to the riots," Jasmeet Singh, DCP Special Cell, said.

355.title: Shark Tank India pitchers rejected by Ashneer Grover meet up, fans react
355.article_body: Shark Tank India pitchers Rohit Warrier and Niti Singhal, who were rejected by Ashneer Grover, recently met  and posted a video of their meeting on Instagram. "Weird pitches? Not so weird now!" Niti wrote in the caption. "Divided by Shark Tank united by Ashneer," a person commented while another comment read, "When two people have common enemies, they become friends."

356.title: Veteran actress Sripriya's daughter Sneha gets married to Anmol Sharma
356.article_body: Sneha Sethupathi, daughter of actors Rajkumar Sethupathi and Sripriya, got married to Anmol Sharma in Chennai. A few pictures from their wedding have also surfaced online. According to reports, the pre-wedding festivities started on April 4, and the duo tied the knot on April 6. The wedding was attended by R Sarath Kumar, Radikaa Sarathkumar, Khushbu Sundar and others.

357.title: EU President, diplomatic chief travelling to Kyiv amid conflict
357.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said she is travelling to Ukraine's capital Kyiv, along with the bloc's diplomatic chief Josep Borrell and Slovak PM Eduard Heger. She is the most senior Western leader to go to Kyiv since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. She will hold talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during the visit.

358.title: Elderly man, 3 sons rape his 17-yr-old foster daughter in Chennai, booked
358.article_body: Police booked a 65-year-old man along with his three sons, aged 39, 29 and 24 for allegedly raping his 17-year-old foster daughter. The girl's biological parents had sold her to a couple when she was one month old. Her youngest foster brother sexually abused her when she was 15, later, the other accused also started raping her repeatedly, police said.

359.title: Sec 144 imposed in Assam's Sivasagar as measure to avert anti-social activities
359.article_body: Amid concerns over the law and order situation, the district administration has imposed Section 144 in Assam's Sivasagar, along with a night curfew along the state border with Nagaland, to prevent anti-social activities. The restrictions will remain enforced for the next 60 days or until further notice. Officials have also prohibited pillion-riding on two-wheeler vehicles, with certain exemptions.

360.title: Teen electrocuted to death while taking selfie atop train engine in MP
360.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was electrocuted to death while taking a selfie atop a stationary train engine at Chhatarpur Railway Station in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. "The victim tried to grab an overhead high tension electricity line, which was charged," Railway Protection Force (RPF) inspector Jitendra Kumar said. A few youths manhandled the station master following the incident.

361.title: Woman fearing safety pretends to order pizza on 999 in UK, gets man arrested
361.article_body: A man was arrested after a woman fearing for her safety called 999 and pretended to order a pizza while they were on a bus in the UK. Sensing that the woman was in danger, the police asked her yes or no questions. She was then rescued after the police traced her location using tracking data and arrested the man.

362.title: Always a question mark on Shubman's power-hitting, strike rate: Jaffer
362.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said there is always a question mark on GT opener Shubman Gill's power-hitting and strike rate, but termed his 46-ball 84 against DC at a strike rate of 182.60 as outstanding. Talking about Vijay Shankar, Jaffer stated it's a matter of concern that Shankar got the chance to bat at the number three position for GT.

363.title: Don't buy into phrases like '2 bodies 1 life' for married couples: Vidya Balan
363.article_body: Talking about gender imbalance in society, Vidya Balan said, "When a couple gets married...people use sentences like '2 bodies 1 life' and I keep saying, 'Listen...please don't buy into that because do jism aur aadmi ki jaan...humari jaan rehti nahi hai'." "There's a change in the way we women are looking at ourselves...what we want from our lives," added Vidya.

364.title: Police officers can't use battalion personnel as domestic help: Assam govt
364.article_body: No Assam Police officer will be allowed to use any battalion personnel as domestic help, the Assam government said. The state government added that if any officer is found using battalion personnel for personal, household works then they will have to pay their salary, the government won't pay. "We want to abolish this system," Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

365.title: Ukraine forces now in control of Sumy region bordering Russia: Governor
365.article_body: Ukrainian forces are now in control of the entire northeast region of Sumy along the border with Russia, its governor claimed. "The area is free of orcs," Dmytro Zhyvytsky said, on Facebook, referring to invading Russian troops. However, he warned residents that "the region isn't safe as there are many areas that have been mined and are still not cleared".

366.title: Paytm-backer Elevation Capital raises $670 mn, its largest India fund
366.article_body: Early-stage investor Elevation Capital, which has backed Swiggy and Paytm, among other Indian startups, has closed its latest India-dedicated fund at $670 million, its largest-ever. Elevation said it would look to deploy the fresh capital over a three-year time frame. It will invest in sectors such as consumer internet, fintech, SaaS, apart from emerging themes such as Web3 and cryptocurrency.

367.title: Ajmer bans loudspeakers at religious places to curb noise pollution
367.article_body: Ajmer district administration banned the use of loudspeakers in public and religious places with effect from April 7 to curb noise pollution. Violators who don't abide by the order will be booked under IPC section 188 (Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), the notice read. The administration had earlier banned religious flags and banners in the district.

368.title: Russian forces have fully withdrawn from northern Ukraine: UK
368.article_body: Russian forces have fully withdrawn from northern Ukraine to Belarus and Russia, UK's Ministry of Defence said on Friday. At least some of these Russian forces will be transferred to East Ukraine to fight in the Donbas, it added. "Russian shelling of cities in the east and south continues," the ministry further said.

369.title: Over 5 B'luru schools get bomb threats via email; bomb squads conduct searches
369.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday said that more than five schools in the city have received bomb threats through emails. There is a drill and as per that the bomb squads have reached the spots and are conducting checks, Pant added. As per reports, no explosive material has been found at any of the schools so far.

370.title: Train runs over 3 youths trying to make Instagram reel in Tamil Nadu
370.article_body: Three youths died after a passenger train ran over them near Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu when they were trying to make an Instagram reel. Police said one of the deceased is a college student, while another is a daily wage worker. "We are going through their social media profiles to check if they had uploaded similar videos earlier," an officer said.

371.title: 4th pillar of democracy dismantled: Rahul on journalists stripped in MP
371.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the Madhya Pradesh government after photos of journalists forced to strip to their undergarments at a police station in Sidhi went viral on social media. "The fourth pillar of democracy ‍was dismantled in the lockup! Either sit in the lap of the government and sing their praises or go to jail," Rahul Gandhi tweeted.

372.title: I started shivering when Dhoni asked me to bowl: Harbhajan on 2011 WC semi vs Pakistan
372.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has revealed that he started shivering when MS Dhoni asked him to bowl in the second spell in the 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan. "They were batting really well at that stage. He asked me to bowl after the drinks break. I did not want to show people the pressure," Harbhajan added.

373.title: Kashmiri Pandits stopped from attending event on 'The Kashmir Files' in Pune
373.article_body: Two Kashmiri Pandit community members in Pune were allegedly stopped by police from attending an event on 'The Kashmir Files', said Rohit Kachroo, national coordinator of 'India 4 Kashmir'. The members wanted to ask some questions related to Kashmiri Pandit issues, Kachroo added. "Our purpose was to not let any law and order situation arise," a senior police inspector said.

374.title: Singapore jails Australian for throwing wine bottle, killing Muslim man
374.article_body: A Singapore court sentenced an Australian man to five-and-a-half years in prison for throwing a wine bottle and killing a 73-year-old Muslim man in 2019, saying it was an act of "religious hostility toward Muslims". Andrew Gosling had pleaded guilty to throwing the bottle at a Muslim family group as he was "angry" over ISIS attacks in Bali and Melbourne.

375.title: Ad in Delhi reads 'Russian@20000/-, p**sy@2000/-'; women panel chief posts video
375.article_body: A digital advertisement board at a store in Delhi was allegedly hacked after which obscene advertisements were flashed on it. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal shared a video showing the LED board running the advertisement of a spa, that read, "Russian@20000/-, p**sy@2000/-." "Shameful...Spas are not at all scared by MCD and Delhi Police," Maliwal wrote.

376.title: US Speaker Nancy Pelosi tests COVID-19 +ve, Asia trip delayed
376.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has postponed a planned congressional trip to Asia after she tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. On Wednesday, the 82-year-old was seen at a White House event with US President Joe Biden while not wearing a mask. The White House said that the President has tested negative for COVID-19 after coming into contact with Pelosi.

377.title: RBI won't do anything that goes against sanctions on Russia: Governor Das
377.article_body: During a press conference following the RBI monetary policy announcement, Governor Shaktikanta Das said that RBI "will not do anything that goes against the sanctions" on Russia. Das added, "If and when some rupee-ruble trade mechanism is worked out, you will get to know. We are sensitive to the sanctions." Earlier, India bought oil from Russia at discounted rates.

378.title: Twitter to test letting users 'unmention' themselves in tweets
378.article_body: Twitter will be testing a way to help users "unmention" themselves in tweets. It's doing so to help users "protect" their "peace" and remove themselves from conversations they don't want to be a part of. The experimental offering is limited to the web for now. Twitter has described the test as global but "small".

379.title: IT dept attaches 41 properties linked to Sena leader Yashwant Jadhav
379.article_body: Income Tax department has attached 41 properties linked to Shiv Sena leader and Chairman of the Standing Committee of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Yashwant Jadhav, ANI reported. He is accused of tax evasion, the report added. The attached properties include 31 flats in Byculla's Bilkhadi Chamber Building, a flat worth ₹5 crore in Bandra and Hotel Crown Imperial in Byculla.

380.title: I can't romance Alia Bhatt: Sanjay Dutt on embracing his age
380.article_body: Sanjay Dutt has said he believes in moving with the times and embracing his age. "I can't romance Alia Bhatt," the 62-year-old actor said, adding, "You've to come to terms with it...You've got to move on." Sanjay further said he admires the younger generation of actors, like Alia and her partner Ranbir Kapoor, with whom he'll be seen in 'Shamshera'.

381.title: Liquorice may help with cancer treatment: Study
381.article_body: Liquorice, a popular candy, may help in preventing and treating certain types of cancers, a study stated. Researchers have found that a substance, glycyrrhizin, derived from the liquorice plant, Glycyrrhiza glabra has great anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties. They are studying liquorice further to determine if it could be used to prevent or stop the growth of prostate cancer.

382.title: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane refuses to file bond of good behaviour to Mumbai Police
382.article_body: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane, booked in a case over his statements about Disha Salian's death case investigation, refused to furnish a bond of good behaviour with Mumbai Police and termed the show cause notice "bad in law". Assistant Commissioner of Police Shailendra Dhivar had issued the notice to the BJP MLA asking him to execute a good behaviour bond.

383.title: US Army suspends SpaceX's application to expand Texas launch site
383.article_body: The US Army Corps of Engineers has suspended SpaceX's application for an expansion of its South Texas launch site after it failed to provide requested information. "Without the requested information, the permit process cannot continue," the Army Corps said. The information that officials have sought includes any impacts associated with SpaceX's plans and data on endangered or threatened species.

384.title: Senate confirms Jackson as first Black woman on US Supreme Court
384.article_body: The US Senate on Thursday confirmed Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court, making her the first-ever Black female justice. The 51-year-old was confirmed by a 53-47 vote. US President Joe Biden called the confirmation "a historic moment for our nation". "We have taken another step toward making our highest court reflect the diversity of America," Biden said.

385.title: Faith steers us through stormy seas: RBI Governor quotes Gandhi in note on economy
385.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das concluded his monetary policy speech by quoting Mahatma Gandhi. "It is faith that steers us through stormy seas, faith that moves mountains and faith that jumps across the ocean," he said. Earlier, he said Russia-Ukraine war poses an "overwhelming challenge" and the RBI is "prepared to defend the Indian economy with all instruments at its command".

386.title: Navi Mumbai man denied pre-arrest bail for hiding homosexuality from wife
386.article_body: A court has rejected the pre-arrest bail application of a 32-year-old man from Navi Mumbai, who allegedly cheated his wife by hiding his homosexuality. The woman claimed that her husband allegedly forged a job offer letter, showing ₹14 lakh salary per annum, to impress her and also forced one of his gay partners to accompany them to their honeymoon.

387.title: MP govt planning to teach Bhagavad Gita in degree courses: CM Chouhan
387.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday said the state government is planning to teach Bhagavad Gita in the second year of the degree course. "I have read Gita since childhood," Chouhan said, adding it teaches us to work without thinking about results. "This knowledge enables people to keep on working which...brings encouraging and constructive results," he said.

388.title: Delhi auto drivers call for a strike over CNG price hikes
388.article_body: Sections of auto drivers in Delhi have called for a strike on Friday over CNG price hikes, ANI reported. Associations of auto, cab and taxi drivers will hold protests at Jantar Mantar. "If we ask for ₹10-20 more from passengers, they get off the auto," an auto driver said. CNG price has increased by over ₹9 in seven days.

389.title: Mumbai's Haji Ali, Bandra-Worli sea-link at risk of submergence by 2050: Report
389.article_body: Around 998 buildings and 24 km of road length in Mumbai including Haji Ali dargah, Western Express Highway, Bandra-Worli sea-link, Queen's Necklace on Marine drive are at risk of submergence by 2050, as per the RMSI report. In addition to Mumbai, places in Kochi, Mangalore, Chennai, Visakhapatnam, and Thiruvananthapuram are also at risk of submergence, the report said.

390.title: Baba Ramdev rings opening bell as Ruchi Soya FPO shares list at 30% premium
390.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev and Patanjali CEO Acharya Balkrishna were seen ringing the opening bell at the BSE as Ruchi Soya's follow-on public offering shares listed on Friday. The shares opened at ₹855 on NSE and at ₹850 on BSE, giving over 30% premium to subscribers who were allotted shares. Before the FPO, Ramdev-led Patanjali owned 98.9% in Ruchi Soya.

391.title: People no longer come to Goa for drugs: Newly appointed Goa DGP
391.article_body: Goa's Director General of Police (DGP) Jaspal Singh, who took charge on Thursday, said people don't visit the coastal state for drugs any more, but for its beaches, culture and cuisine. "We don't want people to remember Goa for drugs," Singh said during his first press conference. He further said that various agencies need to coordinate to control drug cartels.

392.title: T'gana Chief Justice felicitates Hyd home guard for commitment towards duty
392.article_body: Chief Justice of Telangana High Court Satish Chandra Sharma on Friday felicitated Home Guard Ashraf Ali of Abids Traffic Police Station. The Chief Justice used to regularly watch Ali en route to the high court and appreciated his sense of commitment towards duty, Hyderabad Police said. Thus, while going to the High Court today, he felicitated Ali with a bouquet.

393.title: Rishabh Pant fined ₹12 lakh for slow over-rate against LSG
393.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant has been penalised after his team maintained a slow over-rate during their IPL 2022 match against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Thursday. As it was DC's first offence of the season relating to over-rate, Pant was fined ₹12 lakh, the IPL said. LSG defeated DC by six wickets.

394.title: Singer Avril Lavigne gets engaged to boyfriend Mod Sun, shares proposal pics
394.article_body: Singer Avril Lavigne got engaged to her boyfriend Mod Sun in Paris. Avril took to Instagram to share pictures and revealed that the engagement happened on March 27. Commenting on Avril's post, Mod Sun wrote, "I love you so much...Forever and ever my angel." "It was the most perfect, romantic proposal I could ever ask for," Avril told 'People' magazine.

395.title: It is very, very important for every MI player to be desperate: Rohit
395.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said it is very, very important for every MI player to be slightly desperate, with the franchise recently recording their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022. "We seriously cannot be blaming individuals," added Rohit. "We need to seize on the little opportunities during the game and get momentum," stated Rohit.

396.title: What will it take US to criticise Modi govt's actions against Muslims: US politician
396.article_body: US politician Ilhan Omar took to Twitter and wrote, "Why has Biden Administration been so reluctant to criticise Modi's government on human rights?" "What will it take US to criticise Modi govt's actions against Muslims?" she said in a video. "What does Modi need to do to [Muslims] before we will stop considering them a partner in peace?" she added.

397.title: Elon Musk to address Twitter staff in an 'ask me anything' session
397.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter's largest shareholder, will be addressing Twitter employees at an 'ask me anything' session. "Many of you have had different types of questions about...Musk and I want to welcome you to ask those questions to him," Twitter CEO reportedly told staff in an email. The employees have reportedly raised concerns about Musk joining the board.

398.title: No restrictions imposed on news media in Jammu & Kashmir: Centre
398.article_body: Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Anurag Thakur, has said that the Centre has not imposed any restrictions on news media in Jammu & Kashmir.  "Home Ministry has informed that there have been no instances of any harassment to the media persons by the authorities since 2017," Thakur said while responding to a question in Rajya Sabha on Thursday.

399.title: End of BJP in K'taka, says ex-PM Deve Gowda amid loudspeaker issue
399.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has said that implementing the policy of banning the use of loudspeakers by religious sites will be an "end of BJP" in Karnataka. His comments came after the Bengaluru Police issued notices to 301 mosques, temples, churches, restaurants and other establishments to use their loudspeakers within the permissible decibel levels.

400.title: Delhi to get 19 more schools by the end of current financial year: Officials
400.article_body: Delhi will get 19 more schools with state-of-the-art facilities by the end of the current financial year and pre-construction work at several of these schools has started, officials said. The construction of two new schools in Southwest Delhi's Molarband and Gadda Colony area is nearing completion, officials added. Of the 19 schools, 11 will be Schools of Specialised Excellence (SoSE).

401.title: Earlier I could meet only 70% population, now I can meet 100%: Supriyo
401.article_body: TMC candidate for the Ballygunge Assembly by-poll, Babul Supriyo, has said that when he was in BJP, he could meet only "70% of the population" but now he is "free to meet 100%". "A communal stamp was imposed over my image. But it's not true," he said. Notably, West Bengal Imams Association has opposed Supriyo's candidature and called him "communal".

402.title: 66-year-old woman dies after son stabs her multiple times in Gurugram
402.article_body: A 66-year-old woman died after she was allegedly stabbed multiple times by her son in Gurugram's Shivpuri in the New Colony area on Thursday, police said. The incident took place when the victim went to give dinner to her son who lived in a separate house nearby. The exact motive for the murder is yet to be ascertained, police added.
